title: The man behind the battle to return Ukrainian children from Russia
description: Mykola Kuleba, the CEO of Save Ukraine, is helping hundreds of Ukrainian families who they say have been torn apart deliberately by the Russian government.

title: Canada is investigating whether India is linked to the slaying of a Sikh activist
description: Canada is investigating possible links between the Indian government and the assassination of a Sikh activist Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said.

title: Russell Brand postpones comedy tour following sexual assault allegations
description: Russell Brand has postponed his remaining U.K. comedy shows following the publication of multiple sexual abuse allegations against him over the weekend.

title: Blinken on prisoner exchange with Iran: 'Our fellow citizens are free'
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken spoke to reporters after five Americans who were wrongfully imprisoned in Iran. Blinken thanked State Department officials and President Biden for their work and support on the arrangement and assured the U.S. would continue to work to free other Americans wrongfully detained abroad.

title: Americans arrive in Qatar after prisoner swap with Iran
description: The five Americans held for years in Iran have landed in Qatar in a prisoner swap. They will undergo a medical check before returning to the United States. NBC’s Josh Lederman reports for TODAY.

title: Five Americans freed in U.S.-Iran deal arrive in Qatar
description: Five Americans freed as part a deal between the U.S. and Iran involving the release of nearly $6 billion in frozen assetts and an exchange of multiple detainees.

title: British police urged to investigate sexual assault allegations against Russell Brand
description: Senior British politicians on Monday urged police to investigate sexual assault allegations against Russell Brand, as the U.K. entertainment industry faced questions about whether the comedian’s bad behavior went unchallenged because of his fame.

title: Italy gets E.U. backing to curb 'brutal business' of migrant smuggling
description: Tensions have spiked on Lampedusa, the southernmost Italian island, with residents frustrated by the constant flow of migrants trying to reach Europe from North Africa.

title: Americans freed in Iran-U.S. prisoner swap deal
description: Five Americans wrongfully imprisoned in Iran for years have been freed as part of a prisoner exchange agreement. As a result of the deal, billions of dollars in frozen Iranian assets will be transferred to Qatar where the money can then be used to buy humanitarian goods. Iran will also see the release of 5 unnamed Iranian nationals detained in the U.S. in exchange for the five freed Americans. NBC News’ Ali Arouzi has the latest.

title: UNESCO designates ruins near ancient Jericho as World Heritage Site, drawing Israeli anger
description: A U.N. committee voted Sunday to list prehistoric ruins near the ancient West Bank city of Jericho as a World Heritage Site in Palestine, a decision that angered Israel, which controls the territory and does not recognize a Palestinian state.

title: E.U. pledges crackdown on ‘brutal’ migrant smuggling during visit to overwhelmed Italian island
description: European Union Commission President Ursula von der Leyen pledged the swift return of “irregular” migrants to their home countries and a crackdown on the “brutal business” of migrant smuggling Sunday during a visit with Italy’s premier to a tiny fishing island overwhelmed with nearly 7,000 arrivals in a single day this week.

title: China’s foreign minister heads to Moscow after meeting with U.S. national security adviser
description: China’s top foreign policy official is heading to Russia for security talks after two days of meetings with President Joe Biden’s national security adviser over the weekend in Malta.

title: A rifle, fur hat and drones: Kim Jong Un returns to North Korea with gifts from Russia
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un was heading home on Monday, most likely with gifts from his Russian hosts including a rifle, a cosmonaut’s glove, and military drones — which on their own are a violation of U.N. sanctions.

title: Derna resident describes being trapped in floodwaters up to his neck
description: 57-year-old Derna resident Ayyad Salem walked through the muddy streets of his neighborhood and recalled the moment he was trapped in a water-filled room.

title: Americans in Iran to be freed as early as today
description: Five Americans are expected to be released by Iran as part of a deal involving the release of five Iranians held in the U.S. and the unfreezing of $6 billion of Iranian money. NBC News' Kelly Cobiella reports for Early Today.

title: China flies 103 military planes toward Taiwan in a recent record
description: China’s military sent 103 warplanes toward Taiwan in a 24-hour period in what the island’s defense ministry said Monday was a daily record in recent times.
